ovdesc.p: This file allows the user to group together various T24 Applications. This enables the creation of logical groups which can then be specified directly in a user profile. This will avoid repetition of related applications in different user profiles.
When a modification is entered into the group, it will automatically impact all the profiles which contain this group.

This field is used, together with the associated Fields, 2.1 and 4.1 - 8.1, to specify precisely which records in which Applications may be accessed by the User, using which Versions and Functions.
Note: Versions of Applications may be used to change the screen layout or the rules for Input, Validation and Authorization.

If the same field in USER record is empty, then the value in this field will be used. Defines the end period or the log out time till which the user is allowed access to the system on a specific day defined in the ALLOWED.DAYS.

Note: (1) This field is always displayed formatted with ':' (2) For whole day/night login, start should be 00:00, end should be 24:00 (ie. 24 hours). (3) There may be two or more separate periods each day when the User is allowed to access the System, e.g. morning and afternoon, but not during lunchtime. (4) If only 1 or 2 digits are entered, they correspond to minutes between midnight and 1 o'clock in the morning.
1-4 numeric characters with optional ':' i.e. HHMM or HH:MM Sub-value field associated with ALLOWED.DAYS and DAY.ST.TIME (Optional input)
Specifies the Functions which may be used to access records of the Application entered in the corresponding Field 2.

This field is used, together with the associated Fields 2.1 - 3.1 and 5.1 - 8.1 to specify precisely which Functions the User may be used to access which records in which Applications. Valid Function codes are:
A 2 C D E H I L P Q R S V
(A=Authorise, 2=2nd Authoriser, C=copy, D=Delete, E=Exception, H=History restore, I=Input, L=List, P=Print, Q=Auditor review, R=Reverse, S=See, V=Verify)
If NOT is entered, plus one or more Function codes, the System converts it to a list of all the Functions which are allowed.

Note: Even if the function 'C' (copy) is not allowed, the user will still be able to transfer the ID (together with its enrichment) of a selected record when using the '!' facility during an input function.

0-29 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters: 1. Function codes separated by spaces or 2. NOT + one or more Function codes or 3. N (No Functions allowed) or 4. ALL (All Functions allowed). Multivalue field associated with Fields 2.1 - 3.1 and 5.1 - 8.1. Mandatory input. No Default Value.

If Function 2 (2nd Authorisation) is allowed, but not A (1st Authorisation) the User is allowed to enter Function Code A, a Security Violation is generated if the record requested is not ready for 2nd Authorisation.

If the same field in USER record is empty, then the value in this field will be used. Defines the start of period or the log in time at which the user is allowed access to the system on a specific day defined in ALLOWED.DAYS.

Note: (1) This field is always displayed formatted with ':' (2) There may be two or more separate periods each day when the User is allowed to access the System, e.g. morning and afternoon, but not during lunch time. (3) If only 1 or 2 digits are entered, they correspond to minutes between midnight and 1 o'clock in the morning.
1-4 numeric characters with optional ':' i.e. HHMM or HH:MM Sub-value field associated with ALLOWED.DAYS and DAY.END.TIME (Optional input)

Specifies, when used together with Fields 6.1 - 8.1, precisely which records may be accessed in the Application specified in the corresponding APPLICATION (Field 2.) A record may only be accessed if the field indicated here has a value allowed in the corresponding Fields 6.1 - 8.1.
0-3 numeric characters.
OR Up to 43 characters (type ANY) formatted in the following way:
(i) Up to 24 characters (type ANY) which must be a valid entry on the FILE.CONTROL file, followed by,
(ii) A '>' (greater than) sign, followed by,
(iii) Up to 18 characters (type A) which must be a valid entry on the multivalue field SYS.FIELD.NAME on the STANDARD.SELECTION record for the file specified in (i).
Multivalue field associated with Fields 2.1 to 4.1 and 6.1 to 8.1.

(Optional input. No input means all records may be accessed, regardless of contents.)For multivalue fields, only the field number may be specified, not the entry number, e.g. 21, not 21.1, all entries in the multivalue field will be checked. The System displays the name of the field indicated.
Example 1:
To create a group which allows a User to See and List all Accounts records, but only Input (or change), Copy or Delete Accounts in pounds sterling.
Field 2.1 (APPLICATION) ACCOUNT 4.1 (FUNCTION) L S 2.2 (APPLICATION) ACCOUNT 4.2 (FUNCTION) I C D 5.2 (FIELD NO.) 8 (currency) 6.2 (DATA COMPARISON) EQ (equal) 7.2 (DATA FROM) GBP
Example 2:
To create a group which allows a User access to Account records only if they have Currency equal GBP and Category not in the range 01-001 to 01-099.

Field 2.1 (APPLICATION) ACCOUNT 4.1 (FUNCTION) ALL 5.1 (FIELD.NO) 8 (Currency) 6.1 (DATA.COMPARISON) EQ (equal) 7.1 (DATA.FROM) GBP 2.2 (APPLICATION) ACCOUNT 4.2 (FUNCTION) ALL 5.2 (FIELD.NO) 2 (Category) 6.2 (DATA.COMPARISON) NE (not equal) 7.2 (DATA.FROM) 01-001 8.2 (DATA.TO) 01-099
Example 3:
To allow a User to Authorise Data Capture records, but only if they do not contain an override.
Field 2.1 (APPLICATION) DATA.CAPTURE 4.1 (FUNCTION) A 5.1 (FIELD.NO) 24 (Override) 6.1 (DATA COMPARISON) LT (Less Than) 7.1 (DATA.FROM) " (lowest possible value)

Note: It is not possible to prevent a User from entering on override during input, but Authorisation can be restricted, as above, to ensure that any overrides are checked by a more senior person. " is the lowest value a field can have, so specifying LT (Less Than) " ensures that no override may be present.

If the same field in USER record is empty, then the value in this field will be used. Specifies the day for which the period for users access to the system is taken from the associated fields DAY.ST.TIME and DAY.END.TIME. The values allowed are 1 to 7 meaning 1 MONDAY, 2 TUESDAY and 7 SUNDAY.

This field is used, together with the associated Fields 3.1 to 8.1 to specify precisely which records in which Applications can be accessed by the User using which Versions and Functions. It must be the name of an existing Application, ALL.PG to allow access to all Applications or ALL.PG (program type) to allow access to all Applications of a certain type (see below).
The following program types may be used in conjunction with ALL.PG (e.g. ALL.PG.H) to give access to a particular type of program:-
Program Type Meaning
H Programs for which the standard 3 files exist - Live, Unauthorised and History, e.g. CUSTOMER.
U Programs for which Live and Unauthorised files exist, but no History, e.g. VERSION.
L Programs for which only a Live file exists (updated automatically by the system) e.g. STMT.ENTRY (only L, S and P functions can be used with this type of program).
M Programs which are designed to do something other than processing the standard T24 functions using a specific file e.g. PASSWORD.ENABLE, End Of Day Batch programs.
T Programs which handle automatically updated CONCAT files, e.g. CUSTOMER.ACCOUNT (only L, S and P functions can be used with this type of program).
Note: The following 3 type M programs are available to all users and cannot be restricted:-
SIGN.ON SIGN.OFF PASSWORD

When defining the enquires a user can run, you can also 'turn off' all SMS checks for a particular enquiry. This is useful when the enquiry presents non sensitive information from sensitive files. I.e you may wish to show customer and account static information (address, account titles etc ) but not show the balances. As the enquiry itself controls the presentation there may be no need for any additional security. To suppress SMS you must append *NOSMS to the name of the enquiry. E.G. Field 2.1 (APPLICATION) ENQUIRY.SELECT Field 4.1 (FUNCTION) I Field 5.1 (FIELD.NO) 0 Field 6.1 (DATA.COMPARISON) EQ Field 7.1 (DATA.FROM) CUSTOMER.STATIC*NOSMS
This mechanism works only with ENQUIRY.SELECT and must be entered in the format detailed above.
See details for format.
Input must begin and/or end with 3 dots when DATA.COMPARISON = 'LK' or 'UL'.
